aboutMe.firstParagraph: I'm Lucas Debeve, a 3rd year student in computer science. After studying at an engineering school specialising in aerospace, I'm now working as a computer science teacher.
aboutMe.secondParagraph: I've had a passion for computing since I was 13, and started out by developing games and personal websites. Today, I develop many web applications, each responding to a specific need. I also design data visualization dashboards, previously collected and transformed.

list.title: Uranus
list.description: This web application is an e-learning platform that enables students to follow courses online. Teachers can publish teaching sequences, exercises and projects for their students. Students can then follow the lessons, complete the exercises and projects and obtain marks.

list.title: In The Air
list.description: During this team project, we spent several months gathering, transforming and analyzing data from Air France flights departing from Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport, as well as meteorological data from Météo France. Using interactive dashboards, we linked flight delays and cancellations at this airport with meteorological parameters such as wind, precipitation and frost.

list.title: Mercury Cloud
list.description: This web platform is a personal cloud interface that lets me store and share my files. I developed this application to meet a personal need for file storage.

list.title: Amorti'Sœur
list.description: This web application is a bank loan simulation tool. Users can simulate a loan by entering the amount, term and interest rate. The application then returns the monthly instalments, the total cost of the loan and the amortisation table.

list.title: Studease
list.description: As part of a university project, my team and I developed a web application that allows students to apply for work experience and sandwich courses advertised by companies. Students can also track the progress of their applications and get feedback from companies.

list.title: OuafNotes
list.description: This web application is a report card simulation tool for students at the Reims-Châlons-Charleville IUT. Grades are dynamically retrieved from the IUT intranet and displayed on a report card. Students can then view their grades, their average and check that their year has been validated.
